item.title: 21 June: End of England's Covid lockdown could be delayed by one month
item.description: It comes amid concern over rising cases and the transmissibility of the Delta variant in England.

item.title: Birthday Honours 2021: Covid vaccine heroes recognised by Queen
item.description: The Queen's Birthday Honours also recognise Prue Leith, Arlene Phillips and Jonathan Pryce.

item.title: G7: Leaders to unveil global anti-pandemic action plan
item.description: They will pledge all their resources to ensure a global pandemic like Covid-19 is never repeated.

item.title: The Queen: ‘Are you supposed to be looking as if you’re enjoying yourself?’
item.description: The Queen was not afraid to lighten the mood at the G7 'family photo' taken at the Cornwall summit.

item.title: Covid-19: June unlocking delay considered and honours for vaccine heroes
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday morning.

item.title: Covid: Is there a limit to how much worse variants can get?
item.description: The coronavirus has changed and changed again, getting more transmissible each time.

item.title: Trooping the Colour: Scaled back celebration for Queen's official birthday
item.description: The event will be held at Windsor Castle for the second year running due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Harry Dunn death: Path clear for virtual trial, says foreign secretary
item.description: Dominic Raab says the UK can approach Anne Sacoolas's lawyers about holding some form of virtual trial.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vaccine passports considered for use at big events
item.description: Covid passports could be used at events such as sports matches and concerts, the BBC understands.

item.title: MI6 'body-in-bag': Gareth Williams forensic evidence to be re-examined
item.description: MI6 officer Gareth Williams was found dead inside a zipped holdall at his flat in 2010.

item.title: Humpback whale gulps and spits out Cape Cod lobsterman
item.description: Michael Packard ended up in the marine giant's mouth for about half a minute off Massachusetts.

item.title: The Papers: 'Summer freedom on hold' and EU trade war threat
item.description: Reports of a delay to the planned 21 June date for ending Covid restrictions in England are among the front-page stories.

item.title: 'I could be with people and still feel alone'
item.description: It's been a difficult year for US college students. This is Ana Carmona's story.

item.title: Harry Dunn and the complex world of diplomatic immunity
item.description: The death of British teenager Harry Dunn became a diplomatic struggle between the UK and US.

item.title: Vaccinating children against Covid-19
item.description: Ros Atkins on the debate about giving Pfizer vaccine to children aged 12-15.

item.title: Sunrise social: 'It's great for your mental health'
item.description: A group of young people are combating loneliness by getting together to watch the sun rise.

item.title: Boaters have a close call with a Texas dam
item.description: The four passengers were rescued after their boat got stuck at the top of the dam.

item.title: Milton Keynes girl, 6, cheered by classmates on first 100m walk
item.description: Bea's mum calls it a "massive achievement," after two heart operations due to a rare disorder.

item.title: Week in pictures: 5 - 11 June 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: MH17 plane crash: Horror and hope for families as trial starts
item.description: Four people are on trial for shooting down flight MH17 over eastern Ukraine, but none are in court.

item.title: Playwright revives 1920s football team for dramatic new fixture
item.description: A short-lived club from a brief golden age of women's football is brought back to life on stage.

item.title: Andrew Dymock: The neo-Nazi exposed by the BBC
item.description: Raised in a privileged academic background, Andrew Dymock led two banned neo-Nazi terror groups.

item.title: Download: 'We've got tickets to a post-Covid festival'
item.description: As the UK's post-Covid festival scene restarts, fans explain why Download will be especially upbeat.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Why people are afraid to show support for the Games
item.description: Some Japanese - including athletes - are afraid to come forward and show support for the Olympics.

item.title: Record-breaking hiker's agony at 16-mile walk for bus home
item.description: Matt Girvan hiked a trail which runs the length of Scotland - then had to walk even further when his ferry was cancelled.

item.title: 'Huntington's disease won't stop me having a baby'
item.description: Heather and her husband are going to have a baby, even though Heather's time with the child will be limited.

item.title: Crocodile attack twin: 'You have to fight for the people you love'
item.description: Georgia Laurie tells us about saving her twin, Melissa, from the attack in a lagoon in Mexico.

item.title: Why it's the end of the road for petrol stations
item.description: Many petrol stations will close over the next 20 years, accelerating the shift to electric cars.

item.title: Why some say this Nevada town siren is a racist relic
item.description: The siren has been called a "piece of historical trauma" over its disputed link to sundown towns.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Tragedy of the man-made famine
item.description: Aid workers are still unable to reach large parts of Ethiopia’s Tigray region because of the war there.

item.title: Fact-checking Matt Hancock's Covid claims
item.description: We go over the evidence given by the health secretary on the government's pandemic response.

item.title: E3 2021: What to expect at the world's most influential gaming event
item.description: Newsbeat's gaming reporter Steffan Powell looks ahead at this year's gaming convention.

item.title: Essex and London accents deemed less intelligent, researchers find
item.description: People with London and Essex accents downgrade others with London and Essex accents, a study finds.

item.title: 'Summit security feels like another lockdown'
item.description: The G7 summit is being held in a remote part of Cornwall, and has divided opinion amongst locals.

item.title: ‘One of the top three matches in my life’ – Djokovic on stunning win over Nadal
item.description: Novak Djokovic ends Rafael Nadal's reign at the French Open in a classic semi-final which will be ranked among the all-time great matches.

item.title: 'They sent out a message' - perfect night on and off the pitch for Italy
item.description: The evening in Rome started with a spine-tingling rendition of Nessun Dorma and ended with the Italy team celebrating a defensive block as they beat Turkey 3-0.

item.title: Leading Wales out at Euros will be career highlight - Bale
item.description: Gareth Bale says captaining Wales in their opening match of Euro 2020 against Switzerland on Saturday will be a career highlight.

item.title: Impressive Italy breeze past Turkey in Euro 2020 opener - highlights & report
item.description: Euro 2020 opens in spectacular fashion as Italy get their campaign off to a flying start in front of their own fans against Turkey.

item.title: Pavlyuchenkova & Krejcikova target first Grand Slam singles title
item.description: A new Grand Slam singles champion will be crowned when Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova takes on Barbora Krejcikova in the French Open final.

item.title: Young punishes Root drop as New Zealand frustrate England
item.description: A dropped catch and a questionable umpiring decision prove costly for England on a frustrating second day of the deciding Test against New Zealand.

item.title: Bellator 260: Yaroslav Amosov dethrones Douglas Lima to capture welterweight title
item.description: Yaroslav Amosov takes on three-time Bellator welterweight champion Douglas Lima at Bellator 260 in Connecticut.

item.title: Joe Biden: Unearthing the president's unsung English roots
item.description: An English link has been added to the president's famed Irish ancestry. But is it meaningful to him?

item.title: In Pictures: G7 leaders meet at the seaside
item.description: World leaders are in Cornwall for three days of talks - and the occasional trip to the beach...

item.title: Covax: How many Covid vaccines have the US and the other G7 countries pledged?
item.description: The US is set to confirm it will give 500m doses of the Pfizer vaccine to the international Covax scheme.

item.title: G7: Climate protesters target Cornish summit
item.description: At least 500 people joined a parade in St Ives, chanting "act now" and "sound the alarm".

item.title: Brexit: What's the Northern Ireland Protocol and why is President Biden concerned?
item.description: Why are there now some border checks between Great Britain and Northern Ireland?

item.title: G7 summit: What is it and why is it in Cornwall?
item.description: World leaders will descend on the Cornish coast for face-to-face meetings on Friday 11 June.

item.title: PM gifts photo of Edinburgh anti-slavery mural to Biden
item.description: A framed photograph of an Edinburgh mural of Frederick Douglass was among gifts exchanged by the leaders.

item.title: G7: Carrie Johnson treats spouses to steak, firepits and brie on the beach
item.description: Guide to the G7 spouses, as Carrie Johnson hosts a beach party for the world leaders' other halves.

item.title: G7 summit: A cycling tour of Cornwall's G7 village
item.description: Reporter Nomia Iqbal explores the Cornish village that's hosting the G7 summit.

item.title: G7 tax deal: What is it and are Amazon and Facebook included?
item.description: A deal has been agreed by the world's richest nations to tax global companies more.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can countries pay back pandemic debt?
item.description: Countries around the world have borrowed staggering amounts to deal with the pandemic. But where does a government borrow that money from - and can it ever be paid back?

item.title: Euros: Fans' plans to make the most of it despite Covid
item.description: The beach, a sing-song and a family party - here's how some people are enjoying the tournament.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Covid rules are making things a bit different for Euro 2020 spectators.

item.title: What is taking the knee and why is it an issue at Euro 2020?
item.description: Taking the knee has spread across the world as a statement against racism.

item.title: Euro 2020: A football-hater's guide to surviving the tournament
item.description: Millions of people will be glued to the Euros, but spare a thought for those who can't stand sport.

item.title: Quiz: How well do you know the Euros? Take our bumper quiz
item.description: Ten rounds, 125 possible answers - take on our quiz and test your Euros knowledge.
